comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: The text on the fuselage Levez Ici marking the points where to manhandle the machine give away that this is a G.III which was captured by the French. On the side of the fuselage is still the German registration G.III 180/17. This could be an original colour picture of that time as the French army had a special photographic report unit taking colour pictures. Mark the large mud shields visible at the undercarriage wheels.

comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: Correction, the roundel is Belgian as can better be seen in this black and white version of this picture. www.flickr.com/photos/14279793@N06/2874754346/in/photolis...
